title: Welcome to Chain Core Dashboard!
content: The dashboard is a UI to be used with the SDKs, which enable your application to communicate with Chain Core.  To get started, learn about the primitives of Chain Core in this 5-minute Tutorial.

title: Tutorial - MockHSM keys - Step 1 of 7
content: Cryptographic private keys are the primary authorization mechanism on a blockchain. They control both the issuance and transfer of asset units. An asset or account will define a single key required for issuance or transfers.

title: Tutorial - Assets - Step 2 of 7
content: An asset is a type of value that can be issued on a blockchain. All units of an asset are fungible and can be transacted directly between parties without the involvement of the issuer.

title: Tutorial - Accounts - Step 3 of 7
content: An account is an object in Chain Core that tracks ownership of assets on a blockchain by creating and tracking control programs. When you create an account, you provide one or more “root” keys and a quorum.

title: Tutorial - Transactions - Step 5 of 7
content: A transaction contains one or more inputs, and one or more outputs. The Chain Core API allows you to build transactions using actions, which include issue, spend and retire.
